x10.matrix.sparse

Class Compress1D

  • x10.matrix.sparse.Compress1D

  • public class Compress1D
    This class provides abstraction of compressed 1-dimension array or compressed vector class based on compressed array.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      CompressArray cArray
      x10.lang.Int offset
      x10.lang.Int length

        public void initConst(x10.lang.Int ldm,
             x10.lang.Double v,
             x10.lang.Double nzp,
             x10.lang.Int off,
             CompressArray ca)
        Initialize the Compress1D instance based on given storage and assign each nonzero element by a constant value. Used for debug purpose.
        Parameters:
        ldm - Maximum index, or leading dimension
        v - The value used to initialize each entry
        nzp - Percentage of nonzero entries
        off - Offset of storage data
        ca - The storage for the compressed data

      • clone

        public Compress1D clone()
        Clone this object. The resulting object is allocated in a new memory space, which will be not be shared with other 1D instance, resulting disjointed memory space for 2D and CSC and CSR object. To clone sparse matrix or Compress2D using shared storage among all compressed row/columns, do not use this method.

      • 

        operator()
        

        public x10.lang.Double operator()(x10.lang.Int idx)
        

        Return element value paired with idx in the compressed array
within the range of this.offset and this.offset+this.length
If idx is not found in the surface index array, 0.0D is returned.
This method allows random access of data in column/row given
the surface index, however expensive.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        operator()=
        

        public void operator()=(x10.lang.Int pos,
               x10.util.Pair<x10.lang.Int,x10.lang.Double> w)
        

        Set the surface index and value pair (the left-hand parameters)
to position of the underlying index at this.offset+pos
(pos is the right-hand parameter) in the compressed array
This method does not involve searching in the compressed array.
Using this method should be careful. The compressed array must preserve
the surface indices in creasing order.

To set (surface index, value) pair in the compressed 1D, the
underlying index of surface index needs be found first, and then
use this method. We do not advice to modify the compressed
data or modify sparse matrix after it is created.
        

        • 

      




        

      •

      • 

        find
        

        public x10.lang.Int find(x10.lang.Int index)
        

        Find the underlying index in compressed line for the given
surface index. If not found, -1 is returned.
If found, the underlying index is returned (relative value
to the compressed line's offset.

This method is expensive. The binary search is used.

      • 

        copy
        

        public static void copy(Compress1D src,
        Compress1D dst)
        

        Copy all elements (index-value pairs) from source compress line to target.
The target's offset field is used as the starting position, and the length
field is reset to the source's.
        

        Parameters:
        src - The source compress line
        dst - The target compress line
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        copySection
        

        public static void copySection(Compress1D src,
               x10.lang.Int idxStart,
               Compress1D dst,
               x10.lang.Int idxCount)
        

        Copy a specified range elements from its source to the target.


         The range is specified by the starting index of the original data array (uncompressed) and
number of indexes in the original array.
The traget's compress line's offset is used as the starting point to store the elements,
in the target compress array, and the compress line length field will be reset to the
number of elements (index-value pairs) copied.
The index values in the target starts from 0, and the source index array is adjusted,
using the starting index in the compress line.
        

        Parameters:
        src - The source compress line
        idxStart - The starting index in the uncompressed data array
        dst - The target compress line
        idxCount - The number of data in the uncompressed data array to be copied
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        appendTo
        

        public void appendTo(Compress1D dst,
            x10.lang.Int sttidx)
        

        Copy all elements, and attach at the end of the target. The target indexing values
are updated accordingly.
        

        Parameters:
        src - source compress line
        dst - target compress line
        sttidx - starting index at target

        extract
        

        public void extract(x10.lang.Int startIndex,
           x10.lang.Int length,
           x10.lang.Int destOffset,
           x10.array.Array<x10.lang.Double> dest)
        

        Declaration: extract(startIndex:x10.lang.Int,length:x10.lang.Int,destOffset:x10.lang.Int,dest:x10.array.Array[x10.lang.Double]{self.rank==1}): void.
        Extract a specified range of data from compress line. The range
of starting offset and length is specified in uncompress condition.
        

        Parameters:
        startIndex - starting index of the uncompress array
        length - length of the index range of the uncompress array
        destOffset - offset in the destination
        dest - target array
